meanings.definition: A sucker or adhesive organ found in certain parasitic flatworms.
meanings.sent1: The bothria of the flatworm help it attach to its host.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the bothria to understand how the flatworms feed.
meanings.sent3: The bothria of the flatworm are like tiny suction cups!
meanings.sent4: The bothria act like tiny hooks, allowing the flatworm to stay in place.
meanings.sent5: The bothria of the flatworm are like little sticky fingers holding on tight.

meanings.definition: A type of opening or aperture in certain organisms.
meanings.sent1: The bothria on the organism's body help it breathe.
meanings.sent2: The bothria allow water to flow in and out of the organism.
meanings.sent3: The bothria on the organism look like tiny windows on its skin.
meanings.sent4: The bothria function as doors, opening and closing to regulate airflow.
meanings.sent5: The bothria are like small gates that control the exchange of gases.
